content: Yes, Milanese dialect is still used in daily conversations by many people in Milan and its surrounding areas. It remains an important part of Milanese culture and identity, and is often used in literature, music, and theater today. Additionally, there are ongoing efforts to preserve and promote Milanese dialect through language classes, cultural institutions, and media outlets. While Italian is the official language of Italy, many Milanese people still take pride in their distinct linguistic heritage and continue to use Milanese dialect as a way to connect with their history and community.
